 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרַץ‎</span>] **verb** ==be sick==, only in derived species (Assyrian II. <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***marâƒu***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 426</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מרץֿ‎</span> ***sick person, sickness***, Mordt<sup>ZMG 1876, 32</sup>; Aramaic verb <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרַע‎</span>); — 

**Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְרְצוּ‎</span> [[Job.6.25|Job 6:25]] (but see below); ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְרָץ‎</span> [[Mic.2.10|Mic 2:10]] feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְרֶ֫צֶת‎</span> [[1Kgs.2.8|1Kgs 2:8]] — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֶבֶל נִמְרָץ‎</span> [[Mic.2.10|Mic 2:10]] ***a sore, grievous*** destruction (literally ***made sick***, compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַכָּה נַחְלָה‎</span> [[Jer.14.17|Jer 14:17]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְרֶצֶת קְלָלָה‎</span> [[1Kgs.2.8|1Kgs 2:8]] ***a grievous curse***. — In [[Job.6.25|Job 6:25]] this meaning unsuitable, [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] ***are strong, effective*** [compare Assyrian I. <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***marâƒu***</u></abbr>, ***be difficult, inaccessible*** [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 425 f.</sup>; always of something repelling]. More probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נמרצו‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נמלצו‎</span> ***be sweet*** (compare [[Ps.119.103|Ps 119:103]]) or read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נמלצו‎</span> (q. v.), [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>JQ July, 1897</sup> [[BDB#Du|Du]]. **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהיַּֿמְרִיצְךָ‎</span> [[Job.16.3|Job 16:3]] ***what sickens thee*** (what disturbs, vexes thee) that thou answerest ? 

[<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרֻצָה‎</span>] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרוּצָה‎</span> below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רוץ‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרְצֵעַ‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רצע‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרְצֶ֫פֶת‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רצף‎</span>.
